name: A. Grasshopper And the String
statement:
One day, the Grasshopper was jumping on the lawn and found a piece of
paper with a string. Grasshopper became interested what is the minimum
he should have in order to be able to reach the far end of the string,
jumping only on vowels of the English alphabet. is the maximum possible
length of his jump. Formally, consider that at the begginning the
Grasshopper is located directly in front of the leftmost character of
the string. His goal is to reach the position right after the rightmost
character of the string. In one jump the Grasshopper could jump to the
right any distance from to the value of his . The following letters are
vowels: ”, ”, ”, ”, ” and ”.
